竅字的基本解释

竅
qiào
见“窍”。

竅字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiào］
［《廣韻》苦弔切，去嘯，溪。］
“窍1”的繁体字。
(1)洞；孔穴。
(2)指眼耳口鼻等器官的孔。
(3)指骰子上的凹眼。
(4)指管乐器上的按孔。
(5)挖孔；凿洞。
(6)疏通；贯通。
(7)指心眼儿。比喻心计；主意。
(8)比喻事情的要害或关键。
(9)翘起。
(10)用同“巧”。参见“竅合”、“竅妙”。

竅字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【穴字部】　竅； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页869第03
【廣韻】【正韻】苦弔切【集韻】【韻會】詰弔切，?音?。【說文】穴也，空也。【禮·禮運】地秉陰竅于山川。【疏】謂地秉持于隂氣，爲孔于山川，以出納其氣。【周禮·天官】兩之以九竅之變。【註】陽竅七，隂竅二。【疏】七者在頭露見，故爲陽。二者在下不見，故爲隂。　又凡藥以滑養竅。【疏】凡諸滑物通利往來似竅，故以養之。【山海經】貫胷國，其爲人胷有竅。

考證：〔【禮·禮運】地秉竅于山川。〕　謹照原文地秉下增陰字。

Orifice
Basic explanation of words
Orifice
qiào
See "Aperture".
Orifice
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiào］
["Guangyun" cuts hard, goes to Xiao, Xi. ]
Traditional characters for "Qiao 1".
(1) Hole; hole.
(2) Refers to the holes of the eyes, ears, nose and mouth.
(3) Refers to the concave eyes on the dice.
(4) Refers to the press hole on the wind instrument.
(5) Digging a hole; digging a hole.
(6) Dredge; pass through.
(7) Zhixinyaner. Metaphorical scheming; idea.
(8) It is a metaphor for the crux or key of things.
(9) Cocked.
(10) Use the same "smart". See "Qiao He", "Qiao Miao".
Orifice
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Afternoon Collection] [Acupoint Word Department] 　qiao; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 869 03
[Guang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Suspended and cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Club] Suspended and cut, "Yin". [Said Wen] Acupoints are also empty. 【Rite·Rite Luck】The ground holds the Yin orifice in the mountains and rivers. [Sparse] It is said that the earth adheres to the Yin Qi, and is the hole in the mountains and rivers to pay for its Qi. 【Zhou Li·Tian Guan】The change of the two with the nine orifices. [Note] Seven yang orifices and two yin orifices. 【Sparse】Seven people see in the head, so it is Yang. The two are not seen below, so they are overcast.　Every medicine is used to nourish the body by slipping. 【Sparse】Every slippery thing is easy to communicate with each other, so it is nourished. 【Shanhaijing】Guns the country, it is a person who has a hole in it. Textual research: [[Ritual·Ritual Fortune] The ground is in mountains and rivers. 〕　 I would like to follow the original text to increase Yin.
